business_context: For marketing materials and value proposition, the association wants to showcase the caliber of its membership by highlighting Fortune 500 executives who are members.
prompt: Show me all the Fortune 500 CEOs who are members

data_assertions.sql_validation: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM membership.Member m JOIN membership.Organization o ON m.OrganizationID = o.ID WHERE m.Title LIKE '%Chief Executive Officer%' AND o.TickerSymbol IS NOT NULL
data_assertions.description: Count of CEOs from public companies (those with ticker symbols)
List should include recognizable names like Satya Nadella, Jensen Huang, Marc Benioff

visualization.reasoning: List of people with details is best shown in a table or card layout

interactivity.expected_result: Show full member profile with engagement history
Show company details and all members from that company

sample_sql:
-- List Fortune 500 CEOs
SELECT 
  m.FirstName + ' ' + m.LastName as Name,
  m.Title,
  o.Name as Company,
  o.TickerSymbol,
  o.MarketCapitalization
FROM membership.Member m
JOIN membership.Organization o ON m.OrganizationID = o.ID
WHERE m.Title LIKE '%Chief Executive Officer%'
  AND o.TickerSymbol IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY o.MarketCapitalization DESC;
human_eval_guidance: Verify the list includes real recognizable CEOs (Satya Nadella, Jensen Huang, etc.). Check that company information is displayed. Confirm the count is around 10 members.
common_pitfalls: Including all executives instead of just CEOs; missing the link between members and their organizations; not filtering for public companies; displaying raw data without proper formatting.
